items.item_details: In recognition, appreciation, and celebration of California Teacher Appreciation Week and California Day of the Teacher, East Side Union High School District is requesting adoption of a resolution which declares May 3-9, 2009, as California Teacher Appreciation Week, and May 13, 2009, as California Day of the Teacher.FISCAL IMPACT FUNDING SOURCENONE							NONERECOMMENDATION:It is recommended that the Board of Trustees adopt Resolution #2008/2009-32 declaring May 3-9, 2009, as California Teacher Appreciation Week, and May 13, 2009, as California Day of the Teacher.East Side Union High School DistrictofSanta Clara County, State of CaliforniaRESOLUTION #2008/2009-32May 3-9, 2009 California Teacher Appreciation Week andMay 13, 2009, as Day of the TeacherWHEREAS, teachers make public schools great; andWHEREAS, teachers work to open students minds to ideas, knowledge and dreams; andWHEREAS, teachers keep American democracy alive by laying the foundation for good citizenship; andWHEREAS, teachers fill many roles, as listeners, explorers, role models, motivators and mentors; andWHEREAS, teachers continue to influence us long after our school days are only memories;THEREFORE BE IT RESOLVED, by the East Side Union High School District that all teachers be commended for the contributions they make to successful student achievement.PASSED AND ADOPTED this 9th day of April 2009 by the Governing Board of the East Side Union High School District at its regular meeting held at 830 N. Capitol Avenue, San Jose, State of California.AYES: 	________NOES: 	________ABSENT:	________ABSTENTIONS: 	________I certify that the foregoing resolution was duly introduced, passed, and adopted by the East Side Union High School District Board of Trustees at a meeting held on April 9, 2009._________________________Frank Biehl, ClerkESUHSD Board of Trustees
items.item_text: Adopt Resolution #2008/2009–32 Declaring May 3-9, 2009, as California Teacher Appreciation Week and May 13, 2009, as California Day of the Teacher – Bob Nuñez, Superintendent
items.item_text_raw: 9.01 Adopt Resolution #2008/2009–32 Declaring May 3-9, 2009, as California Teacher Appreciation Week and May 13, 2009, as California Day of the Teacher – Bob Nuñez, Superintendent

items.item_details: In recognition, appreciation and celebration of Classified School Employees Week, the District is requesting adoption of a resolution, which declares May 17-23, 2009, as Classified School Employees Week.FISCAL IMPACT FUNDING SOURCENONE							NONERECOMMENDATION:It is recommended that the Board of Trustees adopt Resolution #2008/2009-33 declaring May 17-23, 2009, as Classified School Employees Week.East Side Union High School DistrictofSanta Clara County, State of CaliforniaRESOLUTION #2007/2008-33May 17-23, 2009, Classified School Employees Week WHEREAS, classified professionals provide valuable services to the schools and students of the East Side Union High School District; andWHEREAS, classified professionals contribute to the establishment and promotion of a positive instructional environment; andWHEREAS, classified professionals serve a vital role in providing for the welfare and safety of East Side Union High School District’s students; and WHEREAS, classified professionals employed by the East Side Union High School District strive for excellence in all areas relative to the educational community; THEREFORE, BE IT RESOLVED, that the East Side Union High School District hereby recognizes and wishes to honor the contributions of classified professionals to quality education in the State of California and in the East Side Union High School District and declares the week of May 17-23, 2009, as Classified School Employees Week in the East Side Union High School District.PASSED AND ADOPTED this 9th day of April 2009 by the Governing Board of the East Side Union High School District at its regular meeting held at 830 N. Capitol Avenue, San Jose, State of California.AYES: 	________NOES: 	________ABSENT:	________ABSTENTIONS: 	________I certify that the foregoing resolution was duly introduced, passed, and adopted by the East Side Union High School District Board of Trustees at a meeting held on April 9, 2009._________________________Frank Biehl, ClerkESUHSD Board of Trustees

meeting_sections.section_name: Superintendent/Board of Trustees - Operational Items/Board Discussion and/or Action

items.item_details: EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICTTO:Board of TrusteesFROM:Bob NuĂąez, SuperintendentPREPARED BY:Dan Moser, Associate Superintendent of Instruction and Human RelationsSUBJECT:Hold Public Hearing at 6:30 p.m. to Consider Downtown College Prep Charter School PetitionBACKGROUNDPursuant to Education Code 47605 a public hearing is required within 30 days following the submission of a charter school petition to the district.  The petition was submitted to the district on March 5, 2009.  When requested by the district an extension of the thirty day requirement for a public hearing may be granted by the petitioning charter school entity.  Such permission was granted by the petitioner, Downtown College Prep. During the public hearing the governing board of the school district shall consider the level of support for the petition by the teachers employed by the district, other employees of the district and parents.  The governing board shall either grant or deny the charter within 60 days of receipt of the petition; however, the date may be extended by an additional 30 days if both parties agree to the extension.  Such agree has been reached and at the May 21, 2009 Board Meeting the governing board shall make its determination.   FISCAL IMPACT:Part of Review ProcessFUNDING SOURCE:Part of Review ProcessRECOMMENDATION:Conduct public hearing to consider level of support for the petition submitted by Downtown College Prep.
items.item_text: Hold Public Hearing at 6:30 p.m. to Consider Downtown College Prep Charter School Petition - Dan Moser, Associate Superintendent of Instruction and Human Relations
items.item_text_raw: 10.01 Hold Public Hearing at 6:30 p.m. to Consider Downtown College Prep Charter School Petition - Dan Moser, Associate Superintendent of Instruction and Human Relations

items.item_details: EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICTTO:Board of TrusteesFROM:Bob NuĂąez, SuperintendentPREPARED BY:Dan Moser, Associate Superintendent of Instruction and Human RelationsSUBJECT:Accept Valenzuela/CAHSEE Williams First Quarter ReportBACKGROUNDAs a result of the Williams Case (EC 35186), referred to as a landmark Superior Court case requires that every California public school provide each student with, at the very least, sufficient textbooks and instructional materials; clean, safe and functional buildings and facilities; and permanent, appropriately trained and assigned teachers.  Additionally, under the settlement of the Valenzuela / CAHSEE Settlement (EC 37254) students in grades 10 to 12 inclusive shall be notified of services available to students up to two consecutive years after the completion of grade 12 who have not yet passed the CAHSEE.  School districts shall report summarized data on the nature and resolution of all Williams Complaints and Valenzuela / CAHSEE Complaints on a quarterly basis to the governing board and the county superintendent of schools.  The report shall include the number of complaints by general subject area with the number of resolved and unresolved complaints. The attached report indicates the number of complaints filed from January 1, 2009 through March 31, 2009 and their progress to resolution..FISCAL IMPACT:Unknown at this timeFUNDING SOURCE:Senate Bill 6 (Williams)State Instructional Materials AllocationDistrict Instructional Materials BudgetOther Categorical funds as AppropriateRECOMMENDATION:The administration recommends that the Governing Board accept the fourth Quarterly Valenzuela/CAHSEE and Williams Settlement Uniform Complaint report for the period covering January 1, through March 31, 2009, as required by EC 35186 (Williams Settlement Legislation SB550 and AB2727).
items.item_text: Accept Valenzuela/CAHSEE Williams First Quarter Report - Dan Moser, Associate Superintendent of Instruction and Human Relations
items.item_text_raw: 10.04 Accept Valenzuela/CAHSEE Williams First Quarter Report - Dan Moser, Associate Superintendent of Instruction and Human Relations

items.item_details: EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICTTO:Board of TrusteesFROM:Bob Nuñez, SuperintendentPREPARED BY:Dan Moser, Associate Superintendent of Instruction and Human RelationsSUBJECT:Approve the Community –Based English Tutoring (CBET) Program The purpose of the Community-Based English Tutoring (CBET) Program is for local educational agencies (LEAs) to provide free or subsidized programs of adult English language instruction to parents or other members of the community who pledge to provide personal English language tutoring to English learners. In accordance with Education Code Section 315 and Title 5 of the California Code of Regulations Section 11315, LEAs may use these funds for direct program services, community notification processes, transportation services, and background checks required of the tutors who volunteer in public school settings. FISCAL IMPACT:NoneFUNDING SOURCE:NoneRECOMMENDATION:It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the Community–Based English Tutoring (CBET) Program for 2009-2010.
items.item_text: Approve the Community –Based English Tutoring (CBET) Program - Dan Moser, Associate Superintendent of Instruction and Human Relations
items.item_text_raw: 10.05 Approve the Community –Based English Tutoring (CBET) Program - Dan Moser, Associate Superintendent of Instruction and Human Relations

meeting_sections.section_name: Instructional Services - Operational Items/Board Discussion and/or Action

items.item_details: EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICTTO:Board of TrusteesFROM:Bob NuĂąez, SuperintendentPREPARED BY:Alan Garofalo, Associate Superintendent of Student Services and FacilitiesSUBJECT:Approve New Board Policy #5353 Pertaining to Student LockersIt is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve Board Policy 5353.  The East Side Union High School District shall allow each school site to determine the need for school lockers on the campus in accordance with the school site safety plan.The determination will be based on:1.	Safety and security concerns2.	Instructional considerations3.	Resource availability4.	Physical and structural site capabilityIt is recommended that no student carry books totaling more than 15% of his/her total body weight at any given time.Lockers on a school campus are a convenience for students and therefore schools are not required to have them.  Any school within the district that has lockers on its campus will enforce a policy outlining the rights, responsibilities and liabilities of both student and school.FISCAL IMPACT:N/AFUNDING SOURCE:N/ARECOMMENDATION:It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve Board Policy 5353 –  Lockers.
items.item_text: Approve New Board Policy #5353 Pertaining to Student Lockers - Alan Garofalo, Associate Superintendent of Student Services and Facilities
items.item_text_raw: 11.01 Approve New Board Policy #5353 Pertaining to Student Lockers - Alan Garofalo, Associate Superintendent of Student Services and Facilities

items.item_details: EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICTTO:Board of TrusteesFROM:Bob NuĂąez, SuperintendentPREPARED BY:Alan Garofalo, Associate Superintendent of Student Services and FacilitiesGerri Forte, Director of Career ServicesSUBJECT:Approve Renewal Application and Local Plan for the 2009 – 2010Carl D. Perkins Vocational and Technical Education GrantOverview:The Carl D. Perkins Vocational Education Act of 1998, under Section 131 – Secondary Education, has recommended East Side Union High School District for funding for 2009-2010.  The Perkins Act directs us to: (1) continuously upgrade and improve vocational career-technical education programs, (2) integrate academies with vocational education through a coherent sequence of courses to ensure learning in the core academic and technical subjects, (3) provide students with strong experience and understanding of all aspects of an industry, (4) develop, improve, or expand the use of technology in career technical education, (5) provide professional development to vocational teachers, administrators, and counselors, and (6) develop and implement evaluations of vocational and technical education programs carried out with Perkins funds, including assessment of how the needs of special populations are being met.Accomplishments:In our Local Plan/Application for the Perkins Act, each school site has identified and/or developed integrated career programs in the form of academies or magnet programs, identified and trained teacher teams, and continued with the integration of instruction through incorporation of core subject standards and relevancy activities.  We have also refined our Quality Criteria and Standards for Career-Technical Education programs, established career exploration and assessment activities, developed transition sequences to post secondary study, implemented skill certification programs, and developed a support academy for special education students.Our integrated career paths and academies are aligned with state career incentives.  These include increasing access for special population students, implementing activities to ensure that students are developing employability skills, and increasing work-based learning opportunities for students.FISCAL IMPACT:$548,000FUNDING SOURCE:Carl D. Perkins Vocational and Technical Education Act of 1998, Funding for 2009-2010, PL 105-332RECOMMENDATION:It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the District’s annual application and Local Plan for Carl D. Perkins Vocational and Technical Act Funding for 2009-2010.
items.item_text: Approve Renewal Application and Local Plan for the 2009-2010 Carl D. Perkins Vocational and Technical Education Grant - Alan Garofalo, Associate Superintendent of Student Services and Facilities
items.item_text_raw: 11.02 Approve Renewal Application and Local Plan for the 2009-2010 Carl D. Perkins Vocational and Technical Education Grant - Alan Garofalo, Associate Superintendent of Student Services and Facilities

items.item_details: EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICTTO:Board of TrusteesFROM:Bob Nuñez, SuperintendentPREPARED BY:Dan Moser, Associate Superintendent of Instruction and Human RelationsSUBJECT:Ratify and Approve Tentative Agreement with East Side Teachers Association/CTA/NEA, August 31, 2009 – August 31, 2010Attached is a copy of the proposed changes to the collective bargaining agreement with the East Side Teachers Association/CTA/NEA.  The District and the East Side Teachers Association/CTA/NEA reached a tentative agreement on February 12, 2009.  The tentative agreement was ratified by the East Side Teachers Association/CTA/NEA on March 4, 2009.  We are submitting this agreement to the Board of Trustees for approval.In addition, provisions of AB1200 require that school districts disclose, at a public meeting, the cost that would be incurred by the implementation of a collective bargaining agreement.  In meeting the requirement, a public hearing is being held to give our community an opportunity to comment on the cost of this tentative agreement.FISCAL IMPACT: As per the attached AB1200 documentFUNDING SOURCE: General, Special Education, and Adult Education fundsRECOMMENDATION: It is recommended that the Board of Trustees, per compliance with AB1200, ratify the tentative agreement between the East Side

Our adopted rules of Parliamentary Procedure, Robert's Rules, provide for a consent agenda listing several items for approval of the Board by a single motion.  Most of the items listed under the consent agenda have gone through Board subcommittee review and recommendation.  Documentation concerning these items has been provided to all Board members and the public in advance to assure an extensive and thorough review.  Items may be removed from the consent agenda at the request of any board member.

items.item_details: EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICTTO:Board of TrusteesFROM:Bob NuĂąez, SuperintendentPREPARED BY:Dan Moser, Associate Superintendent of Instruction and Human RelationsSUBJECT:Approve CAHSEE Local Waivers for Special Education StudentsDESCRIPTION: Education Code Section 60851 states that students who take one or both parts of the CAHSEE with a modification and receive the equivalent of a passing score are eligible for the waiver request process.  At the request of the student’s parent or guardian, a school principal must submit to the local school governing board a request for a waiver of the requirement to pass the part(s) of the CAHSEE on which a modification was used and the equivalent of a passing score was earned.  For the local board to waive the CAHSEE requirement, the principal must certify to the local board that the pupil has all of the following:1)	An individualized education program adopted pursuant to the federal Individuals with Disabilities Education Act or a plan adopted pursuant to Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 that requires the accommodations or modifications to be provided to the pupil when taking the high school exit examination.2)	Sufficient high school level coursework either satisfactorily completed or in progress in a high school level curriculum sufficient to have attained the skills and knowledge otherwise needed to pass the high school exit examination.3)	An individual score report for the pupil showing that the pupil has received the equivalent of a passing score on the high school exit examination while using a modification that fundamentally alters what the high school exit examination measures as determined by the State Board of Education.The waivers were requested by the school site administration on behalf of the students’ parents.The recommended waivers meet the aforementioned criteria delineated in Education Code Section 60851: Student A	Student B	Student C	Student D	Student E	Student FStudent G	Student H	Student I	Student J	Student K	Student LStudent M	Student N	Student O	Student P	Student Q	Student RStudent S FISCAL IMPACT:NoneFUNDING SOURCE:NoneRECOMMENDATION:It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the recommended waivers.
items.item_text: Approve CAHSEE Local Waivers for Special Education Students
items.item_text_raw: 16.05 Approve CAHSEE Local Waivers for Special Education Students

items.item_details: EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICTTO:Board of TrusteesFROM:Bob NuĂąez, SuperintendentPREPARED BY:Alan Garofalo, Associate Superintendent of Student Services and FacilitiesSUBJECT:Notice of Completion for James Lick High School New Restroom Building Project. (Zolman Construction and Development Inc.)Bid #B-01-08-09Pursuant to the contract awarded by the Board of Trustees on August 21, 2008, Zolman Construction and Development Inc. has furnished all material and finished all labor for the completion of work related to James Lick High School New Restroom Building Project.With the approval of the Board of Trustees, the attached Notice of Completion will be filed with the Santa Clara County Recorder’s Office as required by law.FISCAL IMPACT:$420,300.00FUNDING SOURCE:Capitol Facilities FundRECOMMENDATION:It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the Notice of Completion for the James Lick High School New Restroom Building Project (Zolman Construction and Development Inc.).
